subject: Re: [junit] Re: one time setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Why test that the file system works? Just verify that you generate the appropriate file and directory paths. The file system works. ... JUnit supports
messageBody:
>So said jbase@... on 2003-05-31 --------------------
>
>I have used one time setup and teardown when testing tools that work on
>directories and files. I want a know set of directories and files (and
>for a backup tool the dates).

Why test that the file system works? Just verify that you generate the appropriate file and directory paths. The file system works.

>I don't see the value in setup/teardown for
>each unit test.

...then you're not doing TDD or Programmer Tests. That's not an accusation, but rather an observation. Programmer Tests should be fast, independent and focus on logic rather than data. You're probably doing integration tests with data sources and front end applications, in which case you'd like to do setup and teardown less often.

>I would like junit to support a onetime setup/teardown for some types of
>tools, although it is possible I would get lazy and use in when I
>shouldn't.

JUnit supports one-time setup/teardown with TestSetup. What does "the tool" have to do with it?
